Comment: The Trump administration went where previous US presidents refused to go in suggesting a mass deportation from Gaza as perhaps the only realistic solution to the conflict. Normally, that would create an immediate and unequivocal eruption of outrage from Arab nations, but this time it's clear that some are considering the idea, at least at some scale.
Author: Sure-Wishbone-4293

Comment: Guaranteed that Hamas’ response will be: “kick rocks, Abbas. We have the guns here, not you, you ineffective weakling.”  They don’t want to give up and leave. That means defeat by the IDF. No way they’ll allow that. They’d rather more people just die instead.

Author: Ask4MD

Comment: I personally see one of two outcomes from all this:  - Hamas is totally wiped out by the IDF and Gaza is lost to the PLA, running out their territory and their grip on anything in that area for a long while, if ever again.   - Hamas muscles out Abbas and other non-Hamas people from the PLA provisional gov for good, takes over full control completely, and ends elections, declaring dictatorial control “for the sake of security and safety of the Palestinian people”, using Israeli incursion as their justification and case to the people, who will eat it up and go along with it.
Author: ITrCool
